skill.name: vercel
skill.description: Deploy and manage Vercel projects, domains, environment variables, and serverless functions using the `vercel` CLI.
skill.summary: Deploy and manage Vercel projects, domains, environment variables, and serverless functions using th...
skill.author: Dicklesworthstone

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill with no executable code. Contains only markdown documentation with example commands for the Vercel CLI. No scripts, network calls, file system access, or external command execution.

content.user_title: Deploy to Vercel from command line
content.value_statement: Deploying frontend projects to Vercel requires navigating multiple CLI commands. This skill provides ready-to-use commands for deployments, domain management, environment variables, and local development without needing to reference external documentation.
actual_capabilities: Deploy current directory or production builds to Vercel
List and inspect deployments with status information
Manage Vercel projects and link local directories
Run local development server with vercel dev
limitations: Requires vercel CLI to be installed on the system
Does not create or configure Vercel accounts
Does not modify DNS settings directly

use_cases.title: Deploy frontend applications
use_cases.description: Quickly deploy React, Next.js, or static sites to Vercel with single commands

use_cases.title: Manage deployment pipelines
use_cases.description: List deployments, inspect logs, and manage environment variables across projects

use_cases.title: Local development workflow
use_cases.description: Run local development server and pull project settings for seamless iteration

prompt_templates.title: Basic deployment
prompt_templates.prompt: Deploy this project to Vercel using the vercel skill

prompt_templates.title: Production deployment
prompt_templates.prompt: Deploy this project to Vercel production using the vercel skill

prompt_templates.title: Check deployment status
prompt_templates.prompt: List recent Vercel deployments and show their status

prompt_templates.title: Environment management
prompt_templates.prompt: Pull environment variables from Vercel to local .env file

output_examples.input: Deploy this project to Vercel production
output: âœ“ View your deployment at: https://your-project.vercel.app

best_practices: Run 'vercel whoami' first to verify you are authenticated
Use 'vercel env pull' to sync environment variables before local development
Test locally with 'vercel dev' before deploying to production
anti_patterns: Deploying directly to production without testing on preview deployments
Hardcoding environment variables instead of using Vercel's env management
Skipping deployment logs review after initial deployment

faq.question: Is the Vercel CLI required?
faq.answer: Yes, this skill provides commands for the Vercel CLI. Install it globally via npm: npm i -g vercel

faq.question: What can I deploy?
faq.answer: Vercel supports Next.js, React, Vue, Svelte, static sites, and serverless functions across many frameworks.

faq.question: How do I link a project?
faq.prompt: Run 'vercel link' to connect your local directory to an existing Vercel project.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: This skill only documents CLI commands. Actual deployment data stays within Vercel's infrastructure.

faq.question: Why is deployment failing?
faq.answer: Common issues include authentication problems, missing build settings, or exceeded account limits. Check logs with 'vercel logs <url>'.

faq.question: How is this different from Vercel integrations?
faq.answer: This skill provides direct CLI access for workflows where you want full control over the deployment process.
